questions.question: A 29-year female presented with a 1.5 cm right breast cancer and clinically and radiologically negative ipsilateral axillary lymph node for metastasis. What is the proper surgical option?
options: Breast conservative surgery with axillary dissection
Breast conservative surgery with sentinel node biopsy

questions.question: A premenopausal 39-year-old woman underwent BCS and node dissection for a 3-cm invasive carcinoma of the right breast. The margins are clear, and 5 out of 15 lymph nodes are involved. ER and PR are negative.
